Reviews.Title: Great Product For the Price
Reviews.Author: Wayward Son
Reviews.Content: After our house was broken into in broad daylight, I decided to install some security measures. In addition to an alarm system, I wanted to install a camera to see what kind of activity there is around our place when we aren't home.A friend has a system with 16 cameras and a DVR. He has upgraded it to a better system a couple times over the last few years. For what it cost, and the work involved in hard-wiring all the cameras in (he has a 3" hole in his wall where all the cables come in), I was not that impressed by the quality of the live feed or the recorded video.I spend a lot of time reading and comparing specs on these wireless cameras. Most of the reviews I read on all the different models included some shortcomings. The biggest complaint people had about this particular camera was focus issues. Some of the reviews talked about how to fix this problem yourself if you happen to get one that is not adjusted correctly, and I am very tech-savy, so this one seemed like the best option for me. As it turned out, mine was fine right out of the box. The picture quality is better than any of the cameras on my friend's system - some of which have been upgraded from the originals that came in his bundle.I had no problem setting the camera up to work over my wifi, and was also able to configure my router so I can view and control it remotely over the internet from a web browser on any computer anywhere. If you are not comfortable changing settings in your router, (it was pretty simple for me, but I'm a computer programmer), you might need a little guidance to get the camera onto your network, and also to make it web-accessible. I'm sure there is lots of info out there on the web on how to do this, and it is simple for anyone who dabbles in this stuff, so just have that geeky kid next door help you if you get stuck!Here are some of my observations on this camera:1. The software lives in the camera, so you don't have to download anything onto your computer to use it. This is nice if you have multiple computers. The software works best with Internet Explorer. It does work with Firefox, but the features aren't as slick. I have not tried it with a Mac (Safari.)2. To set up recording, either motion activated or continuous, you need to open Internet Explorer as an administrator. Just right-click on the IE icon and click "Run as Administrator." Pretty simple! If you don't do this, you won't be able to change the default recording path (where the recordings will be stored on your computer.) The default setting is 'C:\Users\Public\Documents', and since the computer I dedicated to the camera doesn't have a folder at that path, I had to figure out  how to change it.3. The only thing I was a little disappointed in, but completely willing to overlook because of the great price, is the motion activated recording. The camera does not have an infrared motion sensor on it. It senses motion by recognizing changes in the image it is seeing. The problem with this, is that if the light changes, it thinks there is motion, and it records. Each motion event causes it to record for 1 minute. Each recording is a separate file on your computer. There is a box you can check for "motion detection compensation" that is supposed to reduce false alarms caused by changes in lighting. I haven't seen where it has helped at all. Changing the sensitivity (or "Motion Detect Sensibility", as they apparently translated it), does help, but then a person needs to be closer to the camera before they will cause recording to start. The false alarm recordings are numerous on days when a lot of clouds are blowing through and periodically blocking the sun.4. The email feature is pretty cool. You can set it up to email you six pictures each time it records something. You can even set the interval at which it takes the pictures. This is in addition to recording the video. I have mine set at 2 seconds, which works out pretty well. I also set mine up to send me a text message with pictures each time it records. The nice thing about this, is that you know right away if it saw something. I made the picture message work by adding (my cell phone number)@vzwpix.com to the list of email addresses it sends the pictures to. This works for Verizon subscribers. You will have to look up the format for other carriers.5.  If you use Dropbox or something similar, you can set it up to store the videos there, and view them from any computer or device. There are also smart-phone apps you can use to view and control the camera. I am using 'TinyCam Monitor Free', which works pretty well. I haven't had a chance to try any others yet.6. Be aware that this camera does not have any infrared LEDs for night vision. The area my camera is in is well lit, so this was not an issue for me. I can pan it around to a dark area. Other reviews stated that its low-light capability is pretty good, but in my opinion, it's not that great. In a very dimly lit area of my yard that I can see somewhat by eye, the camera can't see anything.7. There is a cool feature that can be set to pan the camera to one of your preset locations as soon as it sees motion. This is nice if you were playing with it and didn't set it back on an entryway or other desired surveillance area. The presets are easy to set and retrieve. They even remember the zoom level the camera was at when you set them and put it back there for each individual preset. It doesn't always hit the presets spot-on when recalled, but it's usually pretty close.8. Be aware that for recording to work, your computer has to be on, awake, and connected to the camera through a web browser. I had an old laptop that I dedicated to my camera. It is an older 32 bit, dual core with 3GB of ram, and it works just fine. It and the camera are both connected to the network over wifi. I just have it set up to stay on when I close the lid, which turns off the screen. You could do the same thing with a desktop  PC, and just have it turn off the monitor after a time. You just can't close the browser or allow it to sleep. The camera will still email you pictures without being connected to a computer, as long as it has an internet connection through your router.Hopefully this review will save you some time. I would have liked to have known this stuff when I was shopping. The bottom line is, this camera has some shortcomings and limitations, but for the price, it is really cool! I would have paid 2 -3 times as much for a wireless tilt/pan/zoom camera with a true motion sensor, higher resolution, and wireless-N capability (which it would need for the higher resolution), but there was just nothing out there that I could find, even in that price range, with those features.

Reviews.Title: Good camera but for the focus
Reviews.Author: Maryann Novak
Reviews.Content: If it wasn't for the focus problem this would be a great camera for the price. The image gets really blurry when the camera is zoomed out (1X/2X zoom).  When zoomed in (3X) the image is great. Until the focus problem is fixed stay away from this one - I'm returning mine.

Reviews.Title: you get what you pay
Reviews.Author: Marco
Reviews.Content: you get what you pay... image definition is not high , the motorized part of the camera on x rotation is not robust and you can break easily

Reviews.Title: good if you know what to do with it
Reviews.Author: Chris Swiontek
Reviews.Content: this model is prone to leak between the bracket and the dome,and around the drip edge at the bottom of the dome and the tinted clear bubble{ they dont come with a gasket between them}... but,with that said,its a pretty good camera {after you put a little silicon around the bracket and dome bell, and around the edges of the tinted bubble at the bottom}also, if you get one out of focus,no worries, there is a little screw {not listed in the instructions anywhere} just under the lense of the camera mechanism inside the dome itself,that can be adjusted to trim the main focus. the low light visibility of this camera is incredible! image is clean and sharp, and works with blue iris {i used the loftek settings in blue iris for the p/t/z/ controls,it was more responsive and the zoom worked better/ that ,and this dome is actually built by loftek anyway=)

Reviews.Title: technical support
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: step by step review with remote logon.  very easy.  i was able to use 2 cameras wirelessly and view from iphone.

Reviews.Title: Real Rating 2.5 stars
Reviews.Author: B. Wong
Reviews.Content: The real rating for this camera should be 2.5 stars because of all the 5 stars that received only 1 is a verified buyer,samething with the 4 stars that received. I assume the NONE VERIFIED BUYERS are fake. ** ( Go click on "ALL MY REVIEWS" under all these none verified buyers and you will see more than likely only this camera.)  All the 3 stars & lower are verified buyers. so averaged out, it should be a 2.5 star rating. check it out, don't be fooled. I am currently looking for a wireless camera, that's why I check all the rating and that was the pattern that I see, funny what people will do. I thought we use a honest system.

Reviews.Title: Try something else.
Reviews.Author: W. P. Hill
Reviews.Content: If you want a good outside camera this isn't it. No night vision and the daytime quality is also less than satisfactory. Setup was not difficult but the camera is overpriced and underperforms. Even my two star rating is a stretch.

Reviews.Title: Fairly easy to install and configure, great performance
Reviews.Author: BobbyG/PS "BG"
Reviews.Content: Setup was a breeze but probably not for the novice, you have to know something about networking. It requires you to hardwire it to the router and then program it from the computer before it becomes wireless. After that it's a camera you simply cannot beat for the price and the zoom is effective. The person reviewing it as fuzzy is used to looking at $3000 cameras, how can you beat 164 bucks? Especially when viewed on your phone which is easier than logging into it from a computer. 5 out of 5 and it worked all winter long down to 20 below. Great value for sure.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: Edwin Prinsen
Reviews.Content: Good camera for the price.  A little knowledge of wireless access is required but setup was pretty easy.The focus at long range is poor, but good up close.  Mounting is difficult because the bracket holes are inline with the camera housing so that you cannot get a screw driver lined up on the screws.

Reviews.Title: Technical Support
Reviews.Author: Steven Farnsworth
Reviews.Content: After speaking with a customer service representative it took an hour for someone to call me back. Once on the phone with technical support they were very quick and efficient. I spoke with Calvin and he was very helpful and setup the camera to be wireless and on my iPhone.I really like the audio feature because I have children and it makes it easier to communicate.

Reviews.Title: Unusable due to focus
Reviews.Author: Paul Brown
Reviews.Content: If the focus was set for distant objects (say 30 feet), I might have kept this camera. As it was, it focused at about 4 to 6 feet at all zoom levels. The user's guide says that the focus is optimally set at the factory and that adjustment shouldn't be attempted, so I returned the unit for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Ok Camera
Reviews.Author: T. Martin
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera to view our property remotely. Although setup was straight forward, port forwarding was a challenge. Thank god for Google. The only negative with this camera is the picture is not clear until full zoom.

Reviews.Title: internet hook-up
Reviews.Author: Alex27519
Reviews.Content: I could not figure out from the instructions how to use my camera through the internet.  However, Michael from the technical support was very quick with doing it for me.  Once I got this resolved, I could use the camera, and it really works great.

Reviews.Title: The camera works, but...
Reviews.Author: B. Muller
Reviews.Content: The firmware needs some basic features.Yes - you can view it through a web browser, or some common viewers, and it's fine for that. I bought the cam because it zooms and supports FTP uploads, but the FTP uploads do not allow you to specify a destination filename. It will save it to your specified folder with whatever filename it decides it wants to save it as (based on the cam MAC address and date and time).Useless to me as I want it to save a cam image to a specified file on a website.The support tab on the agasio wewbsite has said "coming soon" for many months now. I hope there will eventually be a firmware update that will make this usefull.

Reviews.Title: Item was stated used but in very bad shape.
Reviews.Author: D. BOWNE
Reviews.Content: The camera was broke in several pieces and the wires were freyed and seemed to have been spliced to something at some point.  The camera was completely unusable.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Configuration
Reviews.Author: donline
Reviews.Content: Contrary to Foscam's contention, setting up the wireless IP camera is neither quick nor simple. Enter Albert of Foscam's tech support. Thanks to his expertise and "hand-holding" we managed to configure the camera. Albert was as tech savvy as he was polite and professional, which, all things considered made for a very pleasant consumer experience. Thanks again, Albert, for a job well done. Your patience and kind support are greatly appreciated. Keep up the good work and HAPPY NEW YEAR!

Reviews.Title: DID NOT WORK 4 ME
Reviews.Author: Rodger B. Terrey "jeeping rodg"
Reviews.Content: DID NOT WORK 4 ME!!!!! I HAD A SOFTWARE NIGHT MARE TYING TO PROGRAM THIS...I TOOK IT TO MY PC GUY & HE HAD A HARD TIME WITH IT TOO!!! SENT BACK TO AMAZON 4 FULL REFUND

Reviews.Title: Have pending return authorization on first and second (replacement for the first)
Reviews.Author: David Gardner Wells "dgardnerwells"
Reviews.Content: I don't normally leave feedback but I did get a email from Agasio asking me to leave some feedback on the product.  So here goes. The first item arrived in good shape typical box and packing.  The camera was as advertised and instructions  were  based on intermediate tech savvy folks on set up.  Issue I had was the camera in pan mode hesitated at a certain spot.  After hesitation the basic boundaries of the pan became smaller and smaller.  I could reset the boundaries by going to one edge of the camera span and kept clicking to go in the lock direction.  So I decided to return camera and got return auth.  I then ordered replacement.  Received replacement inside the usual air pack amazon box. However the internal product box had damage on corner.  Open box and basically had a electronic mess the dome was broken from the base and the electronics were hanging down. I then got a return auth for the new one as well.  Since the replacement never happened I have been using the original setup and have no issues other then the above hestiation in panning and then having to reset panning area by the above method.  The zoom works and picture quality is as expected for this type of camera.  Wireless reaches farther then expected and connection is good.  Colors are washed out but again as expected for this type of camera.  So far I am thinking 3 stars - minus two for the weak gears for panning that started the return auth mess.

Reviews.Title: Agasio PTZ Camera
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: Don't bother wasting your money or time on this one. I already did both for you.Received the camera damaged (broken).  The camera is mounted inside the housing on a plastic post.  The post was cracked in half, and the camera was rattling inside the housing.  This in turn scratched the inside of the housing lens (cover) rendering the whole camera setup useless.I installed the software on my computer to see if the camera had any life in it.  Nope.  The software did not detect the camera right next to the computer.The instruction manual is written in broken Engrish.  A rocket scientist wouldn't be able to decifer what they are trying to explain.I spared myself any more pain, and returned the whole kit back to Amazon for a full purchase refund. I suggest not going "cheap" like I did on a camera system.  I'm going to look for a good camera system, and pay a little more.Any reccomendations ?

Reviews.Title: camera service
Reviews.Author: Ellen G Villasenor
Reviews.Content: I had an issue with installation of the camera . Spoke with the tech his name was Harry Foster he was able to remotely access my computer and was able to help me in getting the camera up and running wireless. Mr. Foster responded to my call promptly and was very knowledgeable of the task at hand. He waited patiently until I get everything set up.

Reviews.Title: technical support
Reviews.Author: Joe Lagrasta
Reviews.Content: I bought the bought the IP camera. the tecnical support was very helpful, quick to fix my problem would recommend the service.

Reviews.Title: technical support
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: needed help setting up the recording on the camera.Ralph Mendez was very helpful and really knew the best way to fix my problem. Recommend this camera to anyone! Really good quality.

Reviews.Title: Technical Support
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Kate gave me great technical support. I was having trouble with remote viewing my camera. I am very pleased.ThanksMike Adkins

Reviews.Title: Tech Support-Peter
Reviews.Author: JAMES MOORE
Reviews.Content: I HAD THE PLEASURE OF WORKING WITH PETER IN SETTING UP MY REMOTE ACCESS CAMERAS PURCHASED FROM FOSCAM. PETER WAS VERY KNOWLEDGEABLE OF THE TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS OF THE PRODUCT AND SPENT MORE THAN ONE HOUR WORKING WITH ME TO INSURE THAT THE CAMERAS WERE FUNCTIONAL AND WORKING AS DESCRIBED. I CAN'T THANK PETER ENOUGH FOR ALL THE PATIENCE,DEDICATION AND COMMUNICATION SKILLS THAT HE EXHIBITED DURING MY TELEPHONE CONTACT WITH HIM. I HIGHLY RECCOMEND PETER TO ALL USERS OF FOSCAM PRODUCTS.

Reviews.Title: Ip Camera Tech support
Reviews.Author: ROCHELLE RANKIN
Reviews.Content: KateI was having trouble setting up my camera and Kate was excellent help in getting me set up.ThanksRochelle

Reviews.Title: TECHNICAL SUPPORT
Reviews.Author: ralf
Reviews.Content: albert from technical support spent a long time with me and set up my camera for wireless interconnection, as well as remote access.  He was very helpful and knowlegable and courteous. I recommend him highly.  The camera works great, even thru my dirty windows, I can see my neighbor for over 200 feet away.  I highly recommend this camera! Albert did a wonderful job, all the way from India!

Reviews.Title: Blurry with terrible focus and very small viewing frame on the computer. Customer service slow to respond
Reviews.Author: Kathleen M Villa
Reviews.Content: I paid electricians to install this camera so it was done properly.  What a disappointment.  The photos and video from my 11-year old's cell phone are better than the images from this camera.  Everything looks blurry and you cannot tell who somoeone is even five feet away from the camera.  With the electrician fees and the cost of the camera, I spend almost $500 for a piece of junk.  Customer Care took over a week to respond to each of my emails and I could NEVER EVER get through on the phone so wasted my cell minutes too.  Customer Care sent me a return slip after two months to supposedly return the camera and replace it with another one but the electricians mounted it in a metal box so it will be a pain to deal with.  Suggest folks go elsewhere for a security camera.

Reviews.Title: A++ Customer Service and Product
Reviews.Author: Mario G. Bocanegra "Mgb"
Reviews.Content: Michael, My wife and I are expecting our son pretty soon and was really excited to get our Foscam up and running to monitor our son if and when he is in his nursery. We have an AT&T; modem/router and I could not figure out how to setup the port forwarding for my iPhone, as the administrator page was not very easy to navigate through. I was going through the Foscams webpage as the live chat window popped up and asked me if I needed assistance. I informed them of my issue and they took my information and said they would have a technical service rep. call me as soon as possible. I had to leave the house for a while and my phone call came during this time. Mr. Michael asked me when would be a great time to call back and he did just that. WELL, my wife was still getting her toes worked on and I had to ask him to call back again. As before, he did and we were able to get our issue figured out. Mr. Michael was able to access my Mac using team viewer and work through my router to set everything up. This my people is great customer service! A++++. I will definitely use them again!

Reviews.Title: RATING
Reviews.Author: Gustavo Ortiz
Reviews.Content: THE PRODUCT WAS TO MY LIKING AND SATISFACTION.  IT IS EXACTLY WHAT I NEEDED FOR MY CUSTOMERS NEEDS AND PREFERENCES.  THANKYOU.
